org.jtrim.swing.component

Class SimpleAsyncImageDisplay<ImageAddressType>

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.awt.Component
      • java.awt.Container
        • javax.swing.JComponent
          • org.jtrim.swing.component.Graphics2DComponent
            • org.jtrim.swing.component.AsyncRenderingComponent
              • org.jtrim.swing.component.AsyncImageDisplay<ImageAddressType>
                • org.jtrim.swing.component.SimpleAsyncImageDisplay<ImageAddressType>
  • Type Parameters:
    ImageAddressType - the type of the address of the image to be displayed. That is, the input of the image query.
    All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.awt.image.ImageObserver, java.awt.MenuContainer, java.io.Serializable
    Deprecated. 
    This class is very inefficient, use BasicTransformedImageDisplay instead. Defines a Swing component which is able to display an image, applying a series of user defined transformations and convenience methods to apply basic image transformations. This component supports every transformation of the BasicTransformationModel. These basic transformations are applied on transformation index: 0. Other transformations might be applied before and after these transformations by calling any of the setImageTransformer method with the appropriate transformation index.

    Additionally this component is able to display the image using various interpolations and even using multiple interpolations at once. If multiple interpolations are used, they will be used to render the image in the requested order. This can be beneficial when using a fast interpolation first and a slow but better interpolation last. With this settings when rapidly changing the transformation properties of this component, the fast interpolation will be displayed to the user while it calculates the better interpolated image.

    This component defines the offset of the image so that if it is (0.0, 0.0), the center of the image will be in the center of the component.

    Note: You should set the TaskExecutorService used to render the image by calling setDefaultExecutor. You may also use different TaskExecutorService instances for different interpolation types by calling the setExecutor method. Using distinct executors for different interpolation type is advantageous in most cases because it prevents slow interpolations from blocking fast interpolations.

    About other properties of this component see the description of AsyncImageDisplay.

    The thread-safety property of this component is the same as with any other Swing components. That is, instances of this class can be accessed only from the AWT Event Dispatch Thread after made displayable.


    @Deprecated
public class SimpleAsyncImageDisplay<ImageAddressType>
extends AsyncImageDisplay<ImageAddressType>
    See Also:
    AsyncImageDisplay, Serialized Form

      • SimpleAsyncImageDisplay

        public SimpleAsyncImageDisplay()
        Deprecated. 
        Creates a SimpleAsyncImageDisplay with identity transformation applying bilinear transformations (the interpolation type only matters if the transformation is changed to something else than identity).

        The setAsyncRenderer method must be called before displaying the component.

      • SimpleAsyncImageDisplay

        Deprecated. 
        Creates a SimpleAsyncImageDisplay with identity transformation applying bilinear transformations (the interpolation type only matters if the transformation is changed to something else than identity).
        Parameters:
        asyncRenderer - the AsyncRendererFactory to be used to render this component. This argument can be null, in which case, the AsyncRendererFactory must be set later by the setAsyncRenderer method.

        public final TaskExecutorService getDefaultExecutor()
        Deprecated. 
        Returns the TaskExecutorService last set by the setDefaultExecutor method.

        If setDefaultExecutor has not been called yet, this method returns an executor which executes tasks synchronously on the calling thread.

        Returns:
        the TaskExecutorService last set by the setDefaultExecutor method. This method never returns null.

      • setDefaultExecutor

        public final void setDefaultExecutor(TaskExecutorService executor)
        Deprecated. 
        Sets the TaskExecutorService to render the image unless there was another TaskExecutorService specified for the currently applied interpolation type.

        Note: You should always consider using different executors for different interpolation types.

        Parameters:
        executor - the TaskExecutorService to render the image unless there was another TaskExecutorService specified for the currently applied interpolation type. This argument cannot be null.
        Throws:
        java.lang.NullPointerException - thrown if the specified argument was null

        Sets the executor used to render the image when applying the specified interpolation type.

        Note: You should always consider using different executors for different interpolation types.

        Parameters:
        interpolationType - the interpolation type when the specified executor need to be used. This argument cannot be null.
        executor - the TaskExecutorService to be used when applying the specified interpolation type. This argument can be null, in which case the default executor will be used.
        Throws:
        java.lang.NullPointerException - thrown if the specified interpolation type is null

      • setInterpolationTypes

        public final void setInterpolationTypes(InterpolationType... interpolationTypes)
        Deprecated. 
        Sets the interpolation types to be applied to the transformed image. Multiple interpolation types can be specified and they will be applied in the specified order. When specifying multiple interpolations, you should specify the fastest one first and the most accurate one last.

        Eventually only the image rendered with the last specified interpolation type will be displayed to the user but until the last interpolation is applied, the image with the previous interpolation is displayed to user.

        Parameters:
        interpolationTypes - the interpolation types in the order they need to be applied. This argument cannot be null an cannot contain null elements.
        Throws:
        java.lang.NullPointerException - thrown if the specified array or any of its element is null

      • isInZoomToFitMode

        public final boolean isInZoomToFitMode()
        Deprecated. 
        Returns true if the image will be scaled to fit this component. That is, this method returns the same value as the following expression: getZoomToFitOptions() != null.

        If the zoom to fit requirement conflicts with any of the properties of this component, the zoom to fit mode will take precedence.

        Returns:
        true if the image will be scaled to fit the display in which it is displayed, false if it should be displayed according to the other properties of this component

        Returns:
        the set of rules which will be used when displaying the image in zoom to fit mode or null if other properties of this component will be used instead

        Returns:
        true if this component will leave the zoom to fit mode when a transformation property of this component is modified even if setting the property does not conflict with the zoom to fit mode, false otherwise

      • setAlwaysClearZoomToFit

        public final void setAlwaysClearZoomToFit(boolean alwaysClearZoomToFit)
        Deprecated.

        Parameters:
        alwaysClearZoomToFit - if true, this component will leave the zoom to fit mode whenever an image transformation property of this component is changed. If false, this component will only leave the zoom to fit mode if a property is changed which conflicts with the zoom to fit mode.

      • getPointTransformer

        public ImagePointTransformer getPointTransformer()
        Deprecated. 
        Returns the coordinate transformation between image coordinates and display coordinates according to the currently set properties or if it cannot be calculated, according to the displayed image.

        The source coordinate system of the returned transformation is the coordinate system of the image and destination coordinate system is the coordinate system of the display. That is, transforming a coordinate from the source coordinates to the destination coordinate will transform the location of a pixel on the source image to the location of that pixel on this component. Note that the result may lay outside this component's bounds.

        This method is intended to be overridden in subclasses which might be able to calculate the transformations based on other properties and does not have to wait until the image is rendered. The default implementation simply calls the AsyncImageDisplay.getDisplayedPointTransformer() method.

        Implementation note: This method is able to return the coordinate transformations according to the currently set properties if the meta-data of the image to be displayed is already available. Otherwise, this method will fall-back to the getDisplayedPointTransformer() method.

        Overrides:
        getPointTransformer in class AsyncImageDisplay<ImageAddressType>
        Returns:
        the coordinate transformation between image coordinates and display coordinates according to the currently set properties or if it cannot be calculated, according to the displayed image or null if the transformation is not (yet) available

      • getDisplayPoint

        public final java.awt.geom.Point2D getDisplayPoint(java.awt.geom.Point2D imagePoint)
        Deprecated. 
        Returns where the pixel of the image is displayed in this component. The result of (0, 0) means the top-left corner of this component. Note that this method may return a coordinate which lies outside this component and does not need to return integer coordinates.

        This is simply a convenience method which relies on the getPointTransformer() method except that if the coordinate transformation is not yet available this method will return the same coordinates as specified in the argument.

        Parameters:
        imagePoint - the coordinates of the pixel on the source image to be transformed to display coordinates. This argument cannot be null but the coordinates may lay outside the boundaries of the image.
        Returns:
        the coordinates where the specified pixel of the image is displayed. This method never returns null.
        Throws:
        java.lang.NullPointerException - thrown if the specified coordinate is null

      • getImagePoint

        public final java.awt.geom.Point2D getImagePoint(java.awt.geom.Point2D displayPoint)
        Deprecated. 
        Returns which pixel of the source image is displayed at the given coordinate. The result of (0, 0) means the top-left corner of the image. Note that this method may return a coordinate which lies outside the boundaries of the image.

        This is simply a convenience method which relies on the getPointTransformer() method except that if the coordinate transformation is not yet available this method will return the same coordinates as specified in the argument.

        Parameters:
        displayPoint - the coordinates of the display to be converted to image coordinates. This argument cannot be null but the coordinates may lay outside the boundaries of the display. The coordinates (0, 0) specifies the top-left corner of this component.
        Returns:
        the coordinates of the pixel of the source image at the given display coordinate. This method never returns null.
        Throws:
        java.lang.NullPointerException - thrown if the specified coordinate is null
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - thrown if the transformation applied is not invertible

      • moveImagePointToDisplayPoint

        public final void moveImagePointToDisplayPoint(java.awt.geom.Point2D imagePoint,
                                java.awt.geom.Point2D displayPoint)
        Deprecated. 
        Sets the offset of the displayed image, so that the given pixel of the image will be displayed above the given coordinates of this component.

        If the coordinate transformation is not ye available (i.e., getPointTransformer() returns null), this method is a no-op.

        Note that if this method ends up setting the offset of the displayed image, it will clear the zoom to fit mode (i.e.: calls clearZoomToFit()).

        Parameters:
        imagePoint - the coordinates of the image to be displayed at the specified position. This argument cannot be null. These coordinates may lay outside the boundaries of the image.
        displayPoint - the coordinates of this component where the specified pixel of the source image need to be displayed. These coordinates may lay outside the boundaries of this component.
        Throws:
        java.lang.NullPointerException - thrown if any of the arguments is null

      • getExecutor

        public final TaskExecutorService getExecutor(InterpolationType interpolationType)
        Deprecated. 
        Returns the TaskExecutorService which will currently be used for transforming using the given interpolation type. If there was no executor set for the specified interpolation type, this method returns the default executor.
        Parameters:
        interpolationType - the interpolation type whose executor is to be returned. This argument cannot be null.
        Returns:
        the TaskExecutorService which will currently be used for transforming using the given interpolation type. This method never returns null.
        Throws:
        java.lang.NullPointerException - thrown if the specified interpolation type is null

      • getTransformations

        public final BasicImageTransformations getTransformations()
        Deprecated. 
        Returns the snapshot of the currently set transformations. The return value does not include to currently set zoom to fit mode.
        Returns:
        the snapshot of the currently set transformations. This method never returns null.

      • setDefaultTransformations

        public final void setDefaultTransformations()
        Deprecated. 
        Sets the applied transformations to the identity transformations. This method will also remove the zoom to fit mode if set.

      • setTransformations

        public final void setTransformations(BasicImageTransformations transformations)
        Deprecated. 
        Sets all the transformation properties of this component from the specified BasicImageTransformations.

        If this method changes anything, it will invoke the appropriate listeners. Note that this method does not necessarily invoke the listeners only after all properties have been set. That is, the effect of this method cannot be considered atomic in any way.

        This method always calls clearZoomToFit() prior to setting the transformations.

        Parameters:
        transformations - the BasicImageTransformations from which the properties are to be extracted. This argument cannot be null.
        Throws:
        java.lang.NullPointerException - thrown if the specified argument is null

      • setZoomY

        public final void setZoomY(double zoomY)
        Deprecated. 
        Sets the scaling factor used to scale the image vertically. The scaling must be interpreted in the coordinate system of the original image. That is, zoomY adjusts the height of the original image.

        If this method changes anything, it will invoke the appropriate listeners.

        This method always calls clearZoomToFit() prior to setting the property.

        Parameters:
        zoomY - the scaling factor used to scale the image vertically
        See Also:
        TransformationListener.zoomChanged()

      • setZoomX

        public final void setZoomX(double zoomX)
        Deprecated. 
        Sets the scaling factor used to scale the image horizontally. The scaling must be interpreted in the coordinate system of the original image. That is, zoomX adjusts the width of the original image.

        If this method changes anything, it will invoke the appropriate listeners.

        This method always calls clearZoomToFit() prior to setting the property.

        Parameters:
        zoomX - the scaling factor used to scale the image horizontally
        See Also:
        TransformationListener.zoomChanged()

      • setZoom

        public final void setZoom(double zoom)
        Deprecated. 
        Sets the scaling factors used to scale the image horizontally and vertically to the same value. The scaling must be interpreted in the coordinate system of the original image. That is, zoom adjusts both the width and the height of the original image.

        If this method changes anything, it will invoke the appropriate listeners.

        This method always calls clearZoomToFit() prior to setting the property.

        Parameters:
        zoom - the scaling factor used to scale the image both horizontally and vertically
        See Also:
        TransformationListener.zoomChanged()

      • setRotateInRadians

        public final void setRotateInRadians(double radians)
        Deprecated. 
        Sets the angle meaning how much the image need to be rotated around its center in radians. As the angle increases, the image need to be rotated clockwise. The zero angle means that the image is not rotated at all.

        Note: Settings this property also changes the value returned by the getTransformations().getRotateInDegrees() method.

        If this method changes anything, it will invoke the appropriate listeners.

        This method will clearZoomToFit() prior to setting the property, if and only, if the AlwaysClearZoomToFit has been set to true.

        Parameters:
        radians - the angle meaning how much the image need to be rotated around its center in radians. Note that this property is stored in a normalized form. So this property will be set to value between 0 and 2*pi or NaN.
        See Also:
        TransformationListener.rotateChanged()

      • setRotateInDegrees

        public final void setRotateInDegrees(int degrees)
        Deprecated. 
        Sets the angle meaning how much the image need to be rotated around its center in degrees. As the angle increases, the image need to be rotated clockwise. The zero angle means that the image is not rotated at all.

        Notice that this property is an int, if you need better precision, use the setRotateInRadians method.

        Note: Settings this property also changes the value returned by the getTransformations().getRotateInRadians() method.

        If this method changes anything, it will invoke the appropriate listeners.

        This method will clearZoomToFit() prior to setting the property, if and only, if the AlwaysClearZoomToFit has been set to true.

        Parameters:
        degrees - the angle meaning how much the image need to be rotated around its center in degrees. Note that this property is stored in a normalized form. So this property will be set to value which is greater than or equal to zero and less than (not equal) to 360.
        See Also:
        TransformationListener.rotateChanged()

      • setOffset

        public final void setOffset(double offsetX,
             double offsetY)
        Deprecated. 
        Sets both the horizontal an vertical offset need to be applied on the image.

        Note that these offsets are to be applied after zoom has been applied.

        If this method changes anything, it will invoke the appropriate listeners.

        This method always calls clearZoomToFit() prior to setting the property.

        Parameters:
        offsetX - the offset along the horizontal axis. Subsequent getTransformations().getOffsetX() method calls will return this value.
        offsetY - the offset along the vertical axis. Subsequent getTransformations().getOffsetY() method calls will return this value.
        See Also:
        TransformationListener.offsetChanged()

      • setFlipVertical

        public final void setFlipVertical(boolean flipVertical)
        Deprecated. 
        Sets if the image should be flipped vertically. That is, if the top side of the image should become the bottom side of the image.

        If this method changes anything, it will invoke the appropriate listeners.

        This method will clearZoomToFit() prior to setting the property, if and only, if the AlwaysClearZoomToFit has been set to true.

        Parameters:
        flipVertical - if true the image should be flipped vertically, set it to false otherwise
        See Also:
        TransformationListener.flipChanged()

      • setFlipHorizontal

        public final void setFlipHorizontal(boolean flipHorizontal)
        Deprecated. 
        Sets if the image should be flipped horizontally. That is, if the left side of the image should become the right side of the image.

        If this method changes anything, it will invoke the appropriate listeners.

        This method will clearZoomToFit() prior to setting the property, if and only, if the AlwaysClearZoomToFit has been set to true.

        Parameters:
        flipHorizontal - if true the image should be flipped horizontally, set it to false otherwise
        See Also:
        TransformationListener.flipChanged()

      • flipVertical

        public final void flipVertical()
        Deprecated. 
        Inverts the "FlipVertical" property. Calling this method is effectively equivalent to calling: setFlipVertical(!getTransformations().isFlipVertical()).

        This method will notify the appropriate listeners.

        See Also:
        TransformationListener.flipChanged()

      • flipHorizontal

        public final void flipHorizontal()
        Deprecated. 
        Inverts the "FlipHorizontal" property. Calling this method is effectively equivalent to calling: setFlipHorizontal(!getTransformations().isFlipHorizontal()).

        This method will notify the appropriate listeners.

        This method will clearZoomToFit() prior to setting the property, if and only, if the AlwaysClearZoomToFit has been set to true.

        See Also:
        TransformationListener.flipChanged()

      • clearZoomToFit

        public final void clearZoomToFit()
        Deprecated. 
        Removes this component from zoom to fit mode. That is, the image displayed is no longer required to fit the display.

        If this method changes anything, it will invoke the appropriate listeners.

        See Also:
        TransformationListener.leaveZoomToFitMode()

      • setZoomToFit

        public final void setZoomToFit(boolean keepAspectRatio,
                boolean magnify)
        Deprecated. 
        Sets the zoom to fit mode with the following rules: ZoomToFitOption.FIT_HEIGHT, ZoomToFitOption.FIT_WIDTH and with the ones specified in the arguments.

        This method call is equivalent to calling: setZoomToFit(keepAspectRatio, magnify, true, true).

        If this method changes anything, it will invoke the appropriate listeners.

        Parameters:
        keepAspectRatio - if true the zoom to fit mode will also include the rule: ZoomToFitOption.KEEP_ASPECT_RATIO
        magnify - if true the zoom to fit mode will also include the rule: ZoomToFitOption.MAY_MAGNIFY
        See Also:
        TransformationListener.enterZoomToFitMode(Set)

      • setZoomToFit

        public final void setZoomToFit(boolean keepAspectRatio,
                boolean magnify,
                boolean fitWidth,
                boolean fitHeight)
        Deprecated. 
        Sets the zoom to fit mode with the specified rules.

        Subsequent getZoomToFitOptions() method calls will return these set of rules.

        If this method changes anything, it will invoke the appropriate listeners.

        Parameters:
        keepAspectRatio - if true the zoom to fit mode will include the rule: ZoomToFitOption.KEEP_ASPECT_RATIO
        magnify - if true the zoom to fit mode will include the rule: ZoomToFitOption.MAY_MAGNIFY
        fitWidth - if true the zoom to fit mode will include the rule: ZoomToFitOption.FIT_WIDTH
        fitHeight - if true the zoom to fit mode will include the rule: ZoomToFitOption.FIT_HEIGHT
